conclusion: A drives into several groups of blocks of different colors to determine which blocks A will collide with and where A will eventually stop.
A is located on the right side of the image, moving towards the left.
There are three groups of blocks: blue, green, and red. The blue blocks are on the left side, the green blocks are in the middle, and the red blocks are on the right side.
A is moving towards the left side of the image.
A has enough power to drive into the blocks.
When A collides with the blocks, it will either stop or be deflected.
If A collides with the blue blocks, it may be deflected towards the green blocks.
If A collides with the green blocks, it may be deflected towards the red blocks.
A will collide with the red blocks and stop there, as there are no more blocks to be deflected towards.
Therefore, A will collide with the red blocks and stop there.
